intro: Phyllorkis monantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats. Phyllorkis monantha is often found in coastal and inland regions, thriving in well-drained conditions.
